page.title: 12HIGHCLIFFE POLICE STATION
page.content: At Highcliffe police station there is one police officer on the beat all the time with support from other specialist departments. One policeman is on duty riding a bicycle and he works discretionary duties. A total of five policemen drive the police car in Highcliffe but only one is on duty at any one time. It opens daily from 9 a.m. to 10.30 a.m. and again each evening from 6 p.m. to 7.30 p.m. Five police officers are stationed at Highcliffe and these are all men. The notices displayed are mainly missing persons, wanted persons and general information posters. In this area policemen must be at least 5 feet 8 inches <170 cm> tall and police women 5 feet 4 inches <160 cm>. The police station in Highcliffe was built in 1969. My dad is a policeman. By Christopher Morris
